title: Advanced English 510
headline: This free online English course covers how to use relative clauses and cleft sentences and provides musical vocabulary.
description: This English course introduces you to vocabulary related to music and various genres, allowing you to practice your English reading, listening, writing, and speaking skills. We then examine the grammar of defining and non-defining relative clauses and review noun clauses before delving into the many uses of cleft sentences. Sign up for this English course to learn how to discuss music and become more proficient in this universal language.
courseDescription:
This English course begins by exploring vocabulary related to the world of music and provides an outline of various genres in the industry. Researching this subject matter will enable you to practice your conversational skills in English as you discuss your favorite musicians and their songs. Since engaging in conversations is the best way to master a language, these new words and phrases can help you refine your language skills as they grow and develop.

This course's grammar sections provide an overview of relative clauses and compare defining and non-defining clauses. We then illustrate how to recognize relative pronouns and relative adverbs in sentences and do a review of noun clauses. In the second grammar topic, we demonstrate the many uses of cleft sentences and how you can use them to provide clarity when answering questions.

After these grammar lessons, we offer a range of activities designed to enhance your English reading, listening, speaking, and writing skills, including helpful tips you can use when writing the final draft of an essay. Learning English can open many doors for you, so sign up to master these advanced grammar skills and add valuable words to your vocabulary.
